Body: The linear source-filter theory of speech production ( Fant, G. (1970) Acoustic Theory of Speech Production; Stevens and House (1961)) is very useful for understanding speech synthesis and a foundation for acoustic analysis. I don't know if this is silly to ask, but I'm curious to know whether there are any alternatives to it. Or is it the major theory in the field of acoustic phonetics?
Title: Are there any alternatives to Source-Filter theory?
